name: Primates
description: Order of mammals including monkeys, apes, lemurs, lorises, galagos, tarsiers, and humans. Known for binocular vision, complex social structures, and enhanced cognitive abilities.

name: Carnivora
description: Order of primarily meat-eating mammals including cats, dogs, bears, seals, and walruses. Characterized by specialized teeth for meat consumption.

name: Rodentia
description: Largest order of mammals including rats, mice, squirrels, beavers, and porcupines. Characterized by continuously growing incisors.

name: Chiroptera
description: Order comprising all bats, the only mammals capable of true flight. Most use echolocation for navigation.

name: Artiodactyla
description: Even-toed ungulates including deer, cattle, pigs, antelopes, giraffes, hippos, and camels.

name: Perissodactyla
description: Odd-toed ungulates including horses, rhinoceroses, and tapirs. Characterized by odd number of toes.

name: Cetacea
description: Marine mammals including whales, dolphins, and porpoises. Fully aquatic with distinctive blowholes.

name: Proboscidea
description: Order containing elephants, characterized by long trunks and tusks.

name: Marsupialia
description: Pouched mammals including kangaroos, koalas, wombats, and opossums. Young develop in external pouches.

name: Xenarthra
description: Order including armadillos, sloths, and anteaters. Many have reduced teeth or are toothless.

name: Lagomorpha
description: Order including rabbits, hares, and pikas. Characterized by two pairs of upper incisors.

name: Insectivora
description: Order including hedgehogs, shrews, moles, and solenodons. Primarily insectivorous.

name: Sirenia
description: Aquatic herbivorous mammals including manatees and dugongs. Also known as sea cows.

name: Hyracoidea
description: Order of small, herbivorous mammals known as hyraxes or dassies. Despite size, closely related to elephants.

name: Dermoptera
description: Flying lemurs or colugos. Gliding mammals of Southeast Asia.

name: Tubulidentata
description: Order containing single living species: the aardvark. Characterized by tubular teeth.

name: Monotremata
description: Egg-laying mammals including platypus and echidnas. Most primitive living mammals.

name: Pholidota
description: Order containing pangolins. Characterized by protective keratin scales.

name: Macroscelidea
description: Elephant shrews or sengis. Small, insectivorous mammals with long snouts.

name: Scandentia
description: Tree shrews. Small, arboreal mammals of Southeast Asia.

name: Didelphimorphia
description: Order of opossums. Primarily found in Americas.

name: Diprotodontia
description: Largest order of marsupials including kangaroos, wallabies, possums, koalas, and wombats.

name: Afrosoricida
description: African golden moles and tenrecs. Insectivorous mammals of Africa and Madagascar.

name: Notoryctemorphia
description: Marsupial moles. Blind, burrowing mammals of Australian deserts.

name: Microbiotheria
description: Order containing single living species: monito del monte. Small, arboreal marsupial.

name: Dasyuromorphia
description: Carnivorous marsupials including quolls, Tasmanian devils, and numbats.
